reference_a:
@article{hasselhorn2022,
  title = {The effects of assessment intensity on participant burden, compliance, within-person variance, and within-person relationships in ambulatory assessment},
  author = {Hasselhorn, Kilian and Ottenstein, Charlotte and Lischetzke, Tanja},
  date = {2022-08-01},
  journaltitle = {Behavior Research Methods},
  shortjournal = {Behav Res},
  volume = {54},
  number = {4},
  pages = {1541--1558},
  issn = {1554-3528},
  doi = {10.3758/s13428-021-01683-6}
}
topics: sampling frequency, affect, compliance, extraversion, perceived burden
additional_comments: no beep information available; study 1 of the cited paper; two ESM phases with different number of questionnaires per day; maximum number of observations for both study phases

features.name: beep
features.coding: NA

features.name: treatment
features.coding:
Which beep schedule participants received
3-9: 3 beeps for 1 week, then 9 beeps for 1 week
9-3: 9 beeps for 1 week, then 3 beeps for 1 week

features.name: week
features.coding: 1 or 2

features.name: burden_high
features.coding: unclear

features.name: compliance
features.coding:
Did participant comply with the survey?
0 = no
1 = yes

features.name: well
features.coding:
MDBF1: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very unwell
7 = very well
features.details: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...

features.name: awake
features.coding:
MDBF2: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very tired
7 = very awake
features.details: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...

features.name: relaxed
features.coding:
MDBF3: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very tense
7 = very relaxed
features.details: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
features.construct: relaxation, positive affect, affect, neuroticism, big five

features.name: good
features.coding:
MDBF4: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
1 = very bad
7 = very good

(originally reverse-coded)
features.details: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...

features.coding:

7 = very rested

features.details: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...
features.construct: feeling rested, fatigue, positive affect, affect

features.details: How do you feel at this moment? I feel...

features.name: organized
features.coding:
How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
1 = Very disorganized/unsystematic
7 = Very organized/systematic
features.details: How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
features.source: adapted version based on McCabe, K. O., & Fleeson, W. (2016). Are traits useful? Explaining trait manifestations as tools in the pursuit of goals. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 110(2), 287–301. doi: 10.1037/a0039490

features.name: talkative
features.coding:
How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
1 = Very quiet
7 = Very talkative

(originally reverse-coded)
features.details: How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
features.source: adapted version based on McCabe, K. O., & Fleeson, W. (2016). Are traits useful? Explaining trait manifestations as tools in the pursuit of goals. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 110(2), 287–301. doi: 10.1037/a0039490
features.construct: talkativeness, social behavior, extraversion, big five

features.name: persistent
features.coding:
How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
1 = Very lazy
7 = Very persistent/purposeful
features.details: How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
features.source: adapted version based on McCabe, K. O., & Fleeson, W. (2016). Are traits useful? Explaining trait manifestations as tools in the pursuit of goals. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 110(2), 287–301. doi: 10.1037/a0039490

features.name: outgoing
features.coding:
How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
1 = Very unsociable
7 = Very outgoing

(originally reverse-coded)
features.details: How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
features.source: adapted version based on McCabe, K. O., & Fleeson, W. (2016). Are traits useful? Explaining trait manifestations as tools in the pursuit of goals. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 110(2), 287–301. doi: 10.1037/a0039490

features.name: assertive
features.coding:
How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the ""not applicable"" option
1 = Very unassertive
7 = Very assertive
features.details: How did you behave in the last 30 minutes? If the listed behaviours do not apply choose the "not applicable" option
features.source: adapted version based on McCabe, K. O., & Fleeson, W. (2016). Are traits useful? Explaining trait manifestations as tools in the pursuit of goals. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 110(2), 287–301. doi: 10.1037/a0039490
features.construct: assertive, social behavior,  extraversion, big five

features.name: study_burden
features.coding:
How much of a burden was it to participate in the study today?
1 = not at all
5 = very much
features.details: How much of a burden was it to participate in the study today?
features.source: cf. Stone, A. A., Broderick, J. E., Schwartz, J. E., Shiffman, S., Litcher-Kelly, L., & Calvanese, P. (2003). Intensive momentary reporting of pain with an electronic diary: Reactivity, compliance, and patient satisfaction: Pain, 104(1), 343–351. doi: 10.1016/S0304-3959(03)00040-X (table 3) - adapted time span

features.name: study_interfere
features.coding:
How much did participating in the study interfere with your usual activities?
1 = not at all
5 = very much
features.details: How much did participating in the study interfere with your usual activities?
features.source: cf. Stone, A. A., Broderick, J. E., Schwartz, J. E., Shiffman, S., Litcher-Kelly, L., & Calvanese, P. (2003). Intensive momentary reporting of pain with an electronic diary: Reactivity, compliance, and patient satisfaction: Pain, 104(1), 343–351. doi: 10.1016/S0304-3959(03)00040-X (table 3) - adapted time span

features.name: study_annoy
features.coding:
How much were you annoyed with the number of times beeped per day?
1 = not at all
5 = very much
features.details: How much were you annoyed with the number of times beeped per day?
features.source: cf. Stone, A. A., Broderick, J. E., Schwartz, J. E., Shiffman, S., Litcher-Kelly, L., & Calvanese, P. (2003). Intensive momentary reporting of pain with an electronic diary: Reactivity, compliance, and patient satisfaction: Pain, 104(1), 343–351. doi: 10.1016/S0304-3959(03)00040-X (table 3) - adapted time span

features.name: report_easy
features.coding:
KLA1: How easy or difficult was it for you to report your momentary mood?
1 = very difficult
7 = very easy
features.details: How easy or difficult was it for you to report your momentary mood?
features.construct: emotional clarity, introspective ability, metacognitive awareness

features.name: report_sure
features.coding:
KLA2: How sure or unsure were you regading your reports of your momentary mood?
1 = very unsure
7 = very sure

(originally reverse-coded)
features.details: How sure or unsure were you regading your reports of your momentary mood?
features.construct: emotional clarity, introspective ability, metacognitive awareness

features.name: rt_mdbf5_8
features.description: Reaction time last four mood items

features.description: Reaction time first three personality items
